title: Refactor response body
body: Refactors response body.

title: Update to hyper 1
body:
Updates to `hyper` 1.

Resolves #188.

title: Revert colored crate version pinning
body: Closes #195

title: Use tokio runtime uniformly
body: Uses the `tokio` runtime which is used in the other APIs.

title: Allow configuring the mock server (host, port, assert_on_drop)
feat: return raw socket address
Use only required features for dependencies
Use async mutex for tests
body:
This fixes the clippy warnings.
Also, false positive clippy warning for `vec_init_then_push` has been fixed.

title: Introduce a local IntoHeaderName trait to avoid exposing hyper::header::HeaderName
body: Related to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/179 and the alternative to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/180

title: Use HeaderMap for headers in mock and response
body:
This uses the `http` types `HeaderMap`, `HeaderName` and `HeaderValue` where appropriate, instead of `Vec<(String, String)>`. This disallows invalid header names at the call site.

This is a breaking change, because the functions `Mock::match_header` and `Mock::with_header` no longer accept `&str`. They will accept `&'static str` however.

title: Simplify server pool
body: Improvement for #171

title: Support streaming body
body: Fixes #175

title: Implement created counter on the server pool properly and lower the pool size
body:
Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/171

Turns out the server pool wasn't enabled properly in https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/pull/164 - this PR solves the issue and sets the server pool size to 50. I've also added a more robust test to check that the pool is actually running.

title: Replace tokio Mutexes with sync Mutexes
body:
Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/166

This MR replaces the tokio Mutexes/RwLocks with the sync Mutex/RwLock which is [preferred](https://docs.rs/tokio/latest/tokio/sync/struct.Mutex.html) as long as the sync Mutex is not held across `await` calls.

Since the server state is now wrapped in a sync Mutex, there's no need to call `block_on` inside the `Drop` implementations any more.

It also replaces the tokio oneshot channel that shares the server port with a sync mpsc channel. This was the cause for the server pool blocking on `futures::future::join_all`.

title: The 1.0 :balloon:
body:
- Change text color in diff + add screenshot and docs
- Drop legacy interface
- Uncomment threads tests
- Rename Mock::with_body_from_fn to Mock::with_chunked_body
- Run Windows tests on Github Actions
- Remove mocks when the server is dropped, not when the mock is dropped

title: Bring the server pool back and other small fixes
body:
- Introduce a different server pool
- Remove deadpool as a dependency
- Replace channels with Arc (more reliable)
- Re-enable the server pool

title: Add Mock::with_body_from_request
body: Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/159

title: Don't use outdated function in lib.rs example
body: This example is still using `mockito::mock` instead of creating a `Server`, i guess this was an oversight when changing all the examples.

title: Various fixes
body:
Related to https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/155 and https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/157

- Use reqwest in tests
- Replace std:net::TcpListener with tokio::net::TcpListener
- Make sure oneshot senders don't get dropped before receiving
- Small refactoring in Mock::assert to avoid calling hits twice
- Stream with while not with loop
- Expose a ServerGuard object which dereferences to Server
-  When recycling servers, check if the sender & state are still busy
- Disable server pool for now

title: Introduce graceful shutdown for the Hyper server
Le big rewrite
body:
A rewrite using async and Hyper with full support for multi-threaded test runs, multiple servers/endpoints and other goodies.

The old interface will still be accessible in this version, but will be marked as deprecated, since it still relies on the locking mechanism.

Closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/92 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/94 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/144 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/150

Potentially closes https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/111 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/140 https://github.com/lipanski/mockito/issues/147

TODO:

- [x] Document the server
- [x] Add an HTTP2 test
- [x] Introduce an Error type
- [x] Check for unnecessary unwraps
- [x] Update the README
- [x] Update/remove the benchmark test
- [x] Introduce an error context

title: Handle httpparse error
body:
When httpparse fails to parse a request, it will return an error. For instance when a header is invalid, httparse will return error `Error::HeaderName`.
The current logic was to mark the error and re-enter the loop. When this happens, the buffer may be empty and the test will block indefinitely.

This change marks the request as `parsed` when httparse returns an error parsing the content so this can be returned back to the client.

title: Replace difference library with similar
body:
Replace difference library with similar because difference is no longer
maintained. See advisory: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2020-0095

Updated related tests due to slightly different diffing output.

Fixes #132
